itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, October 31, 2013
title: The holiday shopping season is what's really spooky today
teaser: Economists are worried about consumers' moods as we head toward the end of the year.
description: Economists are worried about consumers' moods as we head toward the end of the year.
contenttemplated:
[{"type":"text/html","content":"

The Halloween parties may be full of Miley Cyrus impersonators and Daft Punk helmets tonight, but after the sugar high, there may be a reckoning for the U.S. economy. The advent of November brings the end-of-the year shopping season and some economists are worried about the mood. Among them is Diane Swonk, chief economist at Mesirow Financial in Chicago.

"}]
contentencoded: The Halloween parties may be full of Miley Cyrus impersonators and Daft Punk helmets tonight, but after the sugar high, there may be a reckoning for the U.S. economy. The advent of November brings the end-of-the year shopping season and some economists are worried about the mood. Among them is Diane Swonk, chief economist at Mesirow Financial in Chicago.
